description._content: ID: D40030-14 Title: Untitled. Illustrator: "Anon (Anon)" Provenance: c.1865 Caption: The sheep lover: a courtesan holding a rose in her right hand and leading a sheep with a human head. N.B. 'A Sheep Husband', a phrase employed at Bengali weddings for taunting or teasing the bridegroom, but perhaps also used for satirizing female domination Notes: Watercolour Source identifier: Add.Or.1875 British Library Shelfmark: Add.Or.1875 If you wish to purchase a high quality copy of this image, please place an order at Images Online imagesonline.bl.uk. The details from the above list should help you locate the images.
